image.alt: Happy patients showing confident smiles at Minga Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Minga Orthodontics blends advanced orthodontic technology with a friendly, patient-first approach to craft confident, healthy smiles for kids, teens and adults. Led by Dr. Ryan Minga, the practice focuses on individualized treatment plans, same-day starts when appropriate, affordable financing, and an office culture that’s welcoming and warm.
Families appreciate our modern, fun environment and the team’s commitment to clear, honest care at every step of the smile journey, from first consult through retention.

items.title: Same-day Treatment
items.text: Start braces or aligners at your exam when indicated to cut visits and get treatment moving sooner.

items.title: Advanced Technology
items.text: We offer LightForce 3D‑printed custom braces, Damon systems, and modern clear aligners for precise, efficient results.

items.title: Flexible Financing
items.text: Interest-free plans, low down payments, and HSA/FSA compatibility make care affordable and predictable.

items.title: Patient-first Culture
items.text: A welcoming office, friendly team, and short wait times create a comfortable experience for every age.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ryan Minga, DDS, MS, is a board-trained orthodontist who combines cutting-edge technology with practical, patient-centered care. He earned his dental degree at Virginia Commonwealth University and completed a three-year orthodontic residency at The Ohio State University, where he received his orthodontic specialty certificate and a Master of Science. Dr. Minga treats children, teens, and adults and is known for clear explanations and careful, individualized treatment planning.

image.alt: Dr. Ryan Minga, orthodontist at Minga Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: From clear aligners to modern braces and retainers, we offer options to fit each patient’s lifestyle and goals.

testimonials.author: Ava Menendez
testimonials.testimonial: “I am so happy we chose Dr. Minga for our children’s orthodontist. All of his staff are so welcoming and knowledgeable... He has a calm manner and works well with kids who are nervous.”

testimonials.author: Amy Federer
testimonials.testimonial: “Fantastic group of people!!! Love this office, the vibe, team, music and decor! Dr. Minga is excellent and will take great care of anyone in your family…”

testimonials.author: Lindsey Blackburn
testimonials.testimonial: “We are new to orthodontics and MO has been great in their consultative approach… If and when we need to proceed with orthodontics, we will certainly commit to Dr. Minga!”

image.alt: Smiling team photo at Minga Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Minga Orthodontics we pair advanced technology with a friendly, family-focused approach to deliver personalized care for children, teens, and adults.
We design treatment plans around each patient, offering LightForce custom braces and Spark clear aligners when appropriate, with an emphasis on comfort and efficient visits.
Families appreciate our easy scheduling, short wait times, and same-day starts when possible, all arranged so busy lives stay on track.
Our goal is to create confident smiles while building lasting relationships, so every patient feels informed, cared for, and welcome in our offices.

Dr. Ryan Minga is the founder and lead orthodontist at Minga Orthodontics. He emphasizes personalized treatment plans and modern, patient-centered care, and he was an early adopter of the LightForce bracket system in central Ohio.

image.alt: Dr. Minga smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Minga earned a B.S. in Biology from Virginia Tech, completed his dental degree at Virginia Commonwealth University, and finished a three-year orthodontic residency at The Ohio State University where he received his specialty certificate and Master of Science.

image.alt: Dr. Minga in a treatment room

paragraphs.text: Raised in Smithfield, Virginia, Dr. Minga draws on his farm roots to guide his practice philosophy. He enjoys time with his wife Courtney and their children, outdoor sports, and being an active member of the Delaware community.

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit begins with a friendly consultation and a complete exam, including X-rays. You’ll meet our team, we’ll review your medical history, and we’ll explain treatment options so you can make an informed decision. If appropriate, same-day treatment may be available to get you started sooner.

We’ll create a customized treatment plan and walk through financing so you know what to expect. Our onboarding is simple: Request Free Consult, Select Low Monthly Payment, then Sit Back, Relax & Get Started. We keep things easy and personal so you feel confident every step of the way.

image.alt: Orthodontic team member consulting with a patient about treatment options

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will help you understand your coverage. Our treatment coordinator works with you to find an affordable plan that fits your budget.

Flexible financing and low monthly payments are available so treatment is achievable. For questions or to schedule, call (740) 573-5007 or schedule online at https://forms.formlync.com/minga/register.
To save time at your appointment, complete our online registration and appointment form before you arrive. The central registration link makes scheduling fast and secure.
If you have questions about paperwork or need assistance, our team is happy to help by phone or at your visit. Completing forms ahead of time lets us focus on your exam and treatment plan.

image.alt: Patient filling out registration form on a tablet for their orthodontic visit

image.alt: Nurturing orthodontic care at Minga Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: LightForce custom 3D‑printed brackets give a truly personalized fit. Dr. Minga was the first orthodontist in central Ohio to offer LightForce, and we use the system to combine comfort with precise, efficient tooth movement.

Damon self‑ligating braces often shorten treatment time and reduce the need for frequent visits. The low‑friction design helps teeth move more smoothly, which can mean fewer emergency visits and greater comfort.

Patients commonly see fastest progress in the first year, with many Damon cases completing between 12 and 24 months. Regular visits usually fall every 8–12 weeks; following our care plan and wearing elastics when prescribed helps keep treatment on track.
Your cooperation matters: keeping scheduled appointments, following diet recommendations, and using elastics or other auxiliaries as directed will help your treatment finish on time.
Damon brackets are designed to be efficient and comfortable; many patients appreciate the reduced chair time and improved hygiene access.

Modern metal braces are lighter, more comfortable, and more discreet than older systems. They remain a reliable, cost‑effective choice for many patients, especially when treating complex tooth movement.
Ceramic, or clear braces, blend with your tooth color to reduce visibility while still delivering dependable results. They’re a great option for patients who want effectiveness with a softer look.

image.alt: Clear ceramic braces and aligner graphic

paragraphs.text: Spark clear aligners are removable and nearly invisible, making them a popular choice for teens and adults who want discretion and the freedom to eat and clean normally.

Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners use precise 3D imaging to create a series of custom, removable trays that gradually shift teeth. They let you eat and brush without bracket restrictions while delivering predictable results when worn as directed.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: After active treatment we provide custom retainers—Hawley or clear options—to protect your new smile. Typical guidance is full‑time wear for a few months, then nightly wear to maintain results long term.

For significant jaw discrepancies we coordinate orthodontic preparation with surgical specialists. Care begins with comprehensive 3D imaging and planning so surgery and post‑surgical orthodontics proceed smoothly and safely.

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about Damon and LightForce braces, surgical orthodontics, retainers, appointments, and day-to-day care at Minga Orthodontics.

accordion.header: How long does Damon braces treatment typically take?

paragraphs.text: Damon treatment at Minga Orthodontics usually ranges from 12 to 24 months depending on complexity. Mild crowding can resolve in 6 to 12 months, while more involved bite corrections may take up to 24 months. We’ll give you a personalized timeline at your first visit.

accordion.header: Can Damon braces shorten treatment time compared to traditional braces?

paragraphs.text: Yes, Damon’s passive self-ligating brackets and memory wires often allow smoother tooth movement and fewer adjustment visits. Many patients finish months sooner than with older bracket systems, though results depend on age, oral hygiene, and appointment compliance.

LightForce brackets are 3D‑printed for each tooth, which improves fit and comfort and can make tooth movement more efficient. Modern bracket designs and customized setups also reduce common pressure points, so many patients report less soreness after adjustments.

image.alt: Smiling patient with braces in bright clinic setting

accordion.header: Will braces hurt and what foods should I avoid?

paragraphs.text: You may feel soreness for a few days after bonding or adjustments, which is normal and usually managed with over‑the‑counter pain relief. Avoid hard, sticky, or chewy foods such as popcorn, nuts, hard candies, and gum to protect brackets and wires. We give a full care guide at your appointment.

Yes. Adults are excellent candidates for surgical orthodontics when jaw alignment requires it. We use comprehensive 3D diagnostics and coordinate care with oral surgeons to plan discreet, effective treatment tailored to each adult patient’s needs.

image.alt: Office logo used for surgical orthodontics information

accordion.header: What is the retainer protocol after treatment?

paragraphs.text: After braces or aligners, retainers are essential. We typically ask patients to wear retainers full‑time for 3 to 6 months, then nightly long term to prevent relapse. Minga provides custom retainers and follow‑up checks to protect your result.

image.alt: Custom orthodontic retainers on a tray

accordion.header: How do I schedule an appointment and where are you located?

paragraphs.text: Scheduling is easy: call us at (740) 573-5007 or fill out our appointment form at https://forms.formlync.com/minga/register. We welcome patients at our Delaware office, 3769 Columbus Pike Suite 100, Delaware, OH 43015, and our Plain City office, 12070 Sycamore Trace, Plain City, OH 43064.
